worldofzuul

Class CommandWords

  • java.lang.Object
    • worldofzuul.CommandWords

  • public class CommandWords
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to hold the handles to each CommandWord object (the enum)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CommandWords()
      Constructor, it creates a HashMap, as defined above, and then it loops through each valid CommandWord (the enum to contain all of the recognized cmds) It puts the recognized commands into the HashMap The for each loop is used to put each command's object into the HashMap, so that the handle to object can always be retrieved

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      CommandWord getCommandWord(java.lang.String commandWord)
      A method to get a command from a string, it basically uses the parameter string to fetch something in the HashMap and then returns it
      boolean isCommand(java.lang.String aString)
      A function to check whether a string is recognized by the system or not (recognized commands are saved in the HashMap validCommands)
      void showAll()
      Prints all the keys in the HashMap, which means all of the commands recognized

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • CommandWords

        public CommandWords()
        Constructor, it creates a HashMap, as defined above, and then it loops through each valid CommandWord (the enum to contain all of the recognized cmds) It puts the recognized commands into the HashMap The for each loop is used to put each command's object into the HashMap, so that the handle to object can always be retrieved

    • Method Detail

      • getCommandWord

        public CommandWord getCommandWord(java.lang.String commandWord)
        A method to get a command from a string, it basically uses the parameter string to fetch something in the HashMap and then returns it
        Parameters:
        commandWord - a string, that is to be "converted" into a commandword
        Returns:
        a CommandWord object, if the parameter is not fund in the hashmap it returns an "unknown" CommandWord

      • isCommand

        public boolean isCommand(java.lang.String aString)
        A function to check whether a string is recognized by the system or not (recognized commands are saved in the HashMap validCommands)
        Parameters:
        aString - the string to check
        Returns:
        true if the string is recognized as a command

      • showAll

        public void showAll()
        Prints all the keys in the HashMap, which means all of the commands recognized
